fields.description:
According to EC2 docs:

http://awsdocs.s3.amazonaws.com/EC2/latest/ec2-clt.pdf

Description field of a security group should only contain: alphanumeric characters, spaces, dashes, and underscores.
fields.summary: security group description should only be allowed to contain a limited set of characters

comments.body:
Sorry for not double-checking with the doc.

But, it appears that the constraints for the security group are much loose than specified in his ticket.

Check out the API description below. On Page 97 of the PDF above.

A description for the security group. This is informational only.
Type: String Default: None Constraints: Up to 255 characters in length
Constraints for EC2-Classic: ASCII characters
Constraints for EC2-VPC: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, spaces, and ._-:/()#,@[]+=&;{}!$*
Required: Yes Example: -d "Web Servers" 

[~vika-test] could you verify this information please?
[~kyolee], [~dkavanagh]: Looks like the pull request for this ticket has been merged, but this case isn't even marked as in progress, patch submitted, or ready for QA.
[~kgill] I just rejected the fix while writing the comment above. Sorry about the confusion.
[~kyolee], restrictions could've changed since the ticket was filed (the above link is to the latest doc which in theory should have currently-enforced restrictions).

[~vika-test] Ok, then between those two separate sets of constraints, which one should we follow?

Constraints for EC2-Classic: ASCII characters
Constraints for EC2-VPC: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, spaces, and ._-:/()#,@[]+=&;{}!$*

For the temporal fix, I would go with the second option:

Constraints for EC2-VPC: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, spaces, and ._-:/()#,@[]+=&;{}!$*

Going with the first option would mean simply dropping the regex check on the description, which will be an easy task to revert.
Why would we follow the restrictions for VPC if we don't even support it yet? We currently only support EC2-Classic.

Created the pull request:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/223

This fix contains the adjustment of the security group description's constraints that are compliant with the EC2-VPC:

Constraints for EC2-VPC: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, spaces, and ._-:/()#,@[]+=&;{}!$*

This fix is not permanent, rather it's designed to restore the condition of the Eucalyptus Console to that automate test can resume.
[~vika-test] in that case, I will remove the description validation check overall since the description can be any ASCII characters.

[~vika-test] Nevermind. This is how to check it:

/^[\x00-\x7F]*$/

Updated pull request has been created:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/223

Fix Verified.

Ascii only restraint is enforced for security group descriptions

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus-console
Arch        : noarch
Version     : 3.4.1
Release     : 0.0.1093.20131112git27a9ca9f.el6
